text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm today we are doing a broiled salmon
glazed with romesco but really this is
called a salmon glazed with whatever and
it's more of a technique than a recipe
there's our salmon and we're all trying
to eat more salmon and it gets boring

and you know I don't know how you make

because you get just good bored so I'm

to even says it on the label and I know
it says brush on to fish after grilling

check the ingredients look at seats all

or say garlic anyway it's got nice stuff
so here we go we're gonna take our

almost anything works here now here's
where you check the back ear fridge
believe it or not it's a great way to
use up that last couple tablespoons of

I'm using romesco that's what I had the
idea is a flavorful sauce almost
anything goes with salmon under high

salmon is delicious that's my theory and
I think you will agree if you do it now
once I put my romesco on there and
spread it over I give it a nice healthy
pinch of kosher salt and under a
preheated broiler and I have a gas stove
so my boilers underneath this is about
four inches away from the flame between
6 and 10 minutes this is just a guide
cuz you know I don't know how thick your
salmon is and how hot your oven is if
you got the electric range you're
probably doing it on the
RAK underneath the you know the coil but
it might took about eight minutes and it
was incredibly delicious and almost
would almost anything you put on there
is gonna glaze on I served it with a
fava bean salad you saw me make that in
another demo it was incredibly delicious
combo with that spicy sauce because
romesco has a has a pretty good kick to
it there you go
any hot sauce would work on this on
almost any mustard sauce almost any
dressing so more of a technique than a
recipe read the post for more info and
